content.description: Very short problem with enjoyable moves. Sit start (or low start if you're short) on good holds.
content.location: Far right side of Big Rocks, facing the river.

content.description: A short problem, but it has some great moves. Start butt on the ground with your right on a bad sloper with a thumb catch, left on the lowest hueco left of the blunt arete. Move your hands up and then pull some weird (yet fun?) moves to gain the slab. Tricky beta.
content.location: On the first boulder you reach when walking from the parking lot towards the river.

climbs.name: Wanksters Make The World Go Round

content.description: Start on two good edges just above the overhang. Campus or go for a super fun heelhook and go straight up!
content.location: In the back right corner of Big Rocks, on the side of the boulder facing away from the river.

content.description: Start matched on a flat ledge, get a good right heel, and then work your way around the lip of the boulder. Top out once you reach the pocket.
content.location: On the far end of the park (nearest the river) on a boulder shaped like a UFO. The start faces up river and the topout faces away from the river.

content.description: Start on the incut rail with your butt low. Look way up and right for a hold, then top out by going left. The first move on this is really reachy, so if you're short, it may prove to be very difficult.
content.location: On the left side of the tall boulder at the far right of the park as you enter. The ground is eroded out from under this problem. Just to the left of "A Wing And A Prayer".

climbs.name: They Don't Get Much Easier Than This

content.description: Start on the far right side of the rail and go straight up. Fun mantle.
content.location: In the corridor behind the first set of rocks you get to from the parking lot.

content.description: A problem that reminds of the crest/lip of a phat wave, (teahupoo) this problem starts with your butt on the ground and goes up just a few holds (3) to a nice top out.
content.location: located on a short boulder as your walking down to the river where the large mushroom shaped rock is this rock/problem will be before that rock.

content.description: SD with hands on the crimp rail above the lip. Make a big move to the next crimp rail above. bring up feet and top out. This is likely a grade harder if short.
content.location: Corridor nearest to parking lot. Right of 'one man down down and a hole in the ground'.

content.description: Start on the two slanting crimps with a high foot. make the crux move to the thin crimp slot then move on to the huecos and top out.This was called Standing Ovation because while sending the route, an unknown man with blue headphones was screaming the lyrics of songs (possibly heavy metal?) on top of the rock for about 15 minutes.
content.location: To the right of the parking lot. If you take the main path down to the river it'll be to the right of the path on the wall with the big hueco. This route is north of The Screamer and sits right next to Butt Rock route.

climbs.name: Some Days Are Better Than Others

content.description: Start with the dead bush between your legs and your butt on the ground. Go straight up over the point.
content.location: In the corridor behind the first set of boulders you reach from the parking lot.

content.description: High start with right hand on right of the blunt arete on good sidepull crimp, left hand on crimp above and left of your head. Fun moves gain the interesting topout.
content.protection: 2 crash pads to cover blocs, a spotter is definitely nice.
content.location: Back of the park, one set of blocks inward from the river. Just to the left of "Wanksters Make The World Go Round", "Like A G6", and "The Eyebrow".

climbs.name: The Screamer
climbs.fa: Nikki Collins (stand start), Zach Wahrer (sit start)

content.description: This problem is short, but is lots of fun. Start sitting with good holds under the overhang (or use the lowest undercling for a harder variation). For an easier variation, start standing.
content.location: In the central area of Big Rocks.

content.description: stars just right of the eyebrow, right side of arete/edge and goes up obvious face arete

The rock skirt is OFF, that is technically the river bed that the boulder is sitting on.This route is the next iteration of 'The Truth is Out There'. It appears that many of the good holds on the face have broken or shed off leaving much smaller holds left over. I wanted to keep the original route catalogued for historical purposes as the movement of the route has changed greatly and the starting hold has changed.Start on the ledge low right of the rail with feet out left. Leading feet first, transition to the middle/left side of the rail. Make a big left hand throw to a 2-3 finger crescent and bring right hand up level on a sloping crimp. continue up bad holds to the good gaston near the top. top out!
content.location: From the parking lot. go to right side of the boulders near the river. Route will be facing the road. Left of 'A Wing and a Prayer'.

climbs.name: One Man Down and a Hole in the Ground

content.description: Start with your butt on the ground and pull up the arete.
content.location: In the corridor behind the first set of rocks you get to when you leave the parking lot.

content.description: Start with right hand on a pocket jug, left hand on an obvious circle sloper, and find feet that will get your butt off the pad. Move up through a crimp, a pinch, and a sloper into three crimps around the corner. Top out using the sloped top. Have a good spotter with you, a fall on the last crimps/top out could send you into the boulder behind you.
content.protection: Couple of crash pads, and a good spotter
content.location: From the parking area, it’s in the far right area close to river.

content.description: Start on the flat edge on the right side of the crack and move your way up in the crack in the rock.
Start on the jugs in the cave, move left to more jugs, throw a heel, top out through crimps and slopers.  Good luck not dabbing; this is about as low as a low-ball gets.
content.location: On the UFO boulder.

content.description: Start on the far left of the Wave boulder, left hand on a weird sidepull and right on a sloper. Go left under the crest of the Wave, then mantle out on the far right.
content.location: Far right side of Big Rocks, facing away from the river, gray graffiti cover up paint marks the middle of the problem.

content.description: Start sitting/laying with good hands and interesting feet. Throw for a good high right hand or use a sea of marginal intermediates. Fun topout.
content.location: Right of "Wanksters Make The World Go Round" in the back right corner of Big Rocks. On the side of the boulder that faces away from the river.

content.description: Start with both hands jammed in the crack below the rock scar. Go up and stay left of the arete on the face. Don't get sucked into the right of the arete and don't dab the right side boulder! Its easy to do both.
content.location: On the first set of boulders you reach after leaving the parking lot and heading towards the river. Look for the white rock scar.

content.description: Start on the flat edge to the right in the crack. Move left under the rock to the slopey edge. Get a high Heel and then big right-hand move to right crimp. Bring left hand up level with right, bump one more left, and then move heel to slopy edge. Right hand to 2 finger edge at top of rock. Bump one more left to be able to mantle to the top.
content.location: Its down main path to the river. the rock is looking directly at UFO and the entrance to the river.

content.description: Start low with left hand on good sidepull and right down really low on the arete on your choice of sidepulls. Get your feet on the wall and then throw for a good hold high on the arete with your right. Top it out!
content.location: In the central area of the Big Rocks park, this problem faces away from the river and is directly right of the distinctive "The Screamer".

content.description: Start matched on a flat ledge in the lip of the cave, get feet, throw a heel and mantle. Short, but a good mantel challenge. A sit start in the back of the cave would be a really good problem and would probably go at V5/6.
content.location: Last boulder in Big Rocks Park when heading down river. When heading down river, but before leaving the park, look for a small cave/roof on your left.

content.description: Start on the lowest jug ~3' off the ground. you have the option to either push straight onto the face or work on the arete before breaking onto the face. crux is getting to the crimp left of the eyebrow.
Start seated with a match on a low left facing flake. Get poor feet, move right to a slopey crimper, then make a huge bump to a good fist sized hueco. Top out!
content.location: To the right of the parking lot, look for a rock corridor whose right hand face has a large, medium, and small sized hueco high on the face. Climb starts below the huecos.

content.description: Start with both hands on the right side of the crack and your left foot on the left side. Get your right foot up onto the right side and then it’s just a matter of adjusting the hand and foot holds slightly to mantle on top of the rock.
content.location: Its a very large, horizontal rock close to the river and the mushroom rock and the wave rock. There’s a large crack in the middle of the boulder where the problem is.

content.description: Start on the left side of the Baby Saucer Boulder (around to the left of Baby Saucer Direct) and traverse uphill. Keep your feet under the overhang of Baby Saucer Direct and top out after you traverse through it.
content.location: The Baby Saucer Boulder is located next to the river. This problem faces away from the river.

content.description: Start under the overhang and go straight up! Short, but fun!
content.location: On the Baby Saucer Boulder, right next to the river.

content.description: Start matched on right facing side pull. Go up and left! Really fun!
content.location: This problem is located on the tallest boulder in the park. Look for it on the far right from the parking lot. Its an overhang with a base that has been carved out by the river.

content.description: starts somewhat low and goes up to sloper holds with a fun mantle.  thats really the best part.
content.location: obvious 2nd boulder from parking lot.

content.description: Almost always sunny. Sometimes the area can be really busy with townfolk, but if you're there during good climbing conditions, it will be empty.
